result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher J. Howe

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Becca.
Case Called: 3:33 pm. 
INCLUDES: 22CF637 & 22CM490.

State appears by DA Teresa Wetzsteon and ADA Ben Vechinski.
Defendant Kristopher Howe appears in person, in custody and with Attorney Heather Roehr and Attorney Natasha VanLieshout.

Date/Time set for continued motion hearing from 10/20/2022.
Court addresses Other Acts Motions. 
Arguments by Attorney Roehr. 
Arguments by DA Wetzsteon. 
COURT makes ruling on Other Acts Motions. 

COURT moves forward with State's Motion to amend the information to include an additional charge. Atty Roehr has no objection to amending the information.
COURT grants State's Motion to amend information to include Ct. 2 (Felony Intimidation of a Witness, Repeater, Domestic Abuse). 
COURT moves forward with arraignment as to Ct. 2 in the amended information.
Amended Information has been filed. Reading waived. R/J. 
PLEA >> NOT GUILTY. 

Status Hearing set for 11/17/2022 to remain on calendar. Parties to schedule another Motion Hearing date to continue arguments on other motions not addressed today.

Adjourned: 4:29 pm.

Case Called: 1:28 pm
INCLUDES 22CF637 & 22CM490.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person and DA Theresa Wetzsteon in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person and Atty Natasha VanLieshout in person.
VRCW.
Date and time set to address the outstanding Motions filed. 
Parties are to address the Addendum to Notice of Motion and Defense Motion to Admit Other Acts of Complaining Witness at the next Motion Hearing.
Parties address Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Evidence of Prior Sexual Relationship and Sexual History;
Atty VanLieshout makes arguments; DA Wetzsteon makes arguments. Rebuttal arguments made. 
Court addresses the parties and makes findings. 
Court Rules on the Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Evidence of Prior Sexual Relationship and Sexual History; Court Excludes Rape Fetish Evidence. 
Parties address the State's Motion in Limine Regarding Rape Shield Evidence- Defense has no objection to Motion. Court Grant's Motion.
Parties address the Defense Motions in Limine (Document 32); Court Grants #1-#4. #5 is granted with the exception of the victim being allowed to be present during trial; officer issue will be revisited. witnesses are subject to sequestration and may be revisited. Court Grants #6-#10. Court Denies #11. Court Defers Paragraph #12 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing. Court Grants #13. Court Defers #14 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing. Court Grants #15-#16.
Atty Roehr requests that the Defendant not wear Jail clothes for Trial and that he be allowed to wear street clothes- Court Grants.
Parties address State's Notice Regarding Defendant's Statements- Defense has no objections. 
Parties address the State's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine. Court Grants #1-#6. Court Defers #7 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing. Court Grants #8-#9. Court Defers #10 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing. Court Grants #11. Court Defers #12 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing. Court Grants #13. Court Defers #14 until 10/25/2022 Motion Hearing.
Defendant's Motions to Admit Other Acts is to be heard at the later Motion hearing. 
Outstanding Motions are to be heard at the Motion Hearing on October 25. 
DATES:
Future dates are to remain on the calendar. 
Adjourned: 2:33 pm

Motion hearing on October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury Trial on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case Called: 3:30 pm
INCLUDES 22CF637 & 22CM490.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person.
VRCW.
Matter is currently scheduled for Jury Trial;
Defense has received majority of Discovery from the State; Defense is requesting Discovery as stated to be resent. State will provide and resend that Discovery requested. 
ADA Vechinski makes statements regarding cell phone discovery; State has filed all Motions that they intended to at this time. 
Court to address the Motions that were filed up to this date at the Motion Hearing on 10/25.

DATES:
Motion Hearing/Jury Status Hearing 10/25/2022 @ 3:30 pm is to remain on the calendar.
Jury Trial to remain on the calendar. 
A future Motion Hearing to be scheduled in November with the Judicial Assistant.                                                                                                          

Adjourned: 3:36 pm

Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury Trial on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Speedy JT Demand filed 8/31/2022 in 22CF637
FPT/TPD (all motions must be filed) 10/7/2022 @ 3:30pm;
JSH & Motion Hearing - 10/25 @ 3:30PM- 1 hr
JT 12/1/2022 @ 8:30am -2 days
Calendar call on September 6, 2022 at 08:05 am.

CC 9/6/2022 @ 8:05am

possible Speedy JT request coming
Pre-trial conference on August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

More discovery needed; outcome of revocation hearing

PTC 8/30/2022 @ 2:30pm

Adj: 1:54 pm.

$5000 signature with first $1000 cash. Includes 22CF637 & 22CM490. To be co-signed by both of deft's parents.   No contact with victim(s): SAH or Walmart in Rib Mtn.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
